p: We first wanted to determine if the age at which a mosquito is offered an infectious blood meal and acquires the ZIKV infection (Age acquisition) impacted the within-vector kinetics of the mosquito. To do this, we looked at infection, dissemination, and transmission of the three treatments in the context of days post-infection. We found no significant difference in the infection ( P > 0.05) or dissemination rates ( P > 0.05) across all treatments (Additional file 1: Table S1). However, when direct age comparisons are made, the effect of Age acquisition on infection becomes obvious (Fig. 2). The average rate of infection of mosquitoes given exposure was 78.2% across all treatments and days post-infection (95% confidence interval: 74.3–82.0%).
